document.title: Physical Education Model Content Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

F748DB70DFE301318EBD68A86D17958E.description: Identify the responsibilities of a leader in physical activity.

F7488B60DFE301318EBC68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate the effect of expressing encouragement to others while participating in a group physical activity.

F747E770DFE301318EBA68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate an acceptance of differences in physical development and personal preferences as they affect participation in physical activity.

F746EDD0DFE301318EB768A86D17958E.description: Identify appropriate and inappropriate risks involved in adventure, individual, and dual physical activities.

F7465B60DFE301318EB568A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate and utilize knowledge of psychological and sociological concepts, principles, and strategies that apply to the learning and performance of physical activity.

F7461040DFE301318EB468A86D17958E.description: Discuss the effect of extremity growth rates on physical fitness.

F745C8B0DFE301318EB368A86D17958E.description: Explain progression, overload, and specificity as principles of exercise.

F7456B20DFE301318EB268A86D17958E.description: Identify and apply the principles of overload in safe, age-appropriate activities.

F7452C30DFE301318EB168A86D17958E.description: Describe the role of physical activity and nutrition in achieving physical fitness.

F744EAD0DFE301318EB068A86D17958E.description: Explain the effects of physical activity on heart rate during exercise, during the recovery phase, and while the body is at rest.

F744A310DFE301318EAF68A86D17958E.description: Match personal preferences in physical activities with each of the five components of health-related physical fitness.

F7445550DFE301318EAE68A86D17958E.description: Identify physical activities that are effective in improving each of the health-related physical fitness components.

F7440E00DFE301318EAD68A86D17958E.description: Develop a one-week personal physical fitness plan specifying the proper warm-up and cool-down activities and the principles of exercise for each component of health-related physical fitness.

F743C8E0DFE301318EAC68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate knowledge of physical fitness concepts, principles, and strategies to improve health and performance.

F7437D30DFE301318EAB68A86D17958E.description: Assess periodically the attainment of, or progress toward, personal physical fitness goals and make necessary adjustments to a personal physical fitness program.

F74334E0DFE301318EAA68A86D17958E.description: Participate in moderate to vigorous physical activity a minimum of four days each week.

F742E4E0DFE301318EA968A86D17958E.description: Plan a weekly personal physical fitness program in collaboration with the teacher.

F7429230DFE301318EA868A86D17958E.description: Develop individual goals, from research-based standards, for each of the five components of health-related physical fitness.

F7425130DFE301318EA768A86D17958E.description: Evaluate individual measures of physical fitness in relationship to patterns of physical activity.

F7420E50DFE301318EA668A86D17958E.description: Assess one's own muscle strength, muscle endurance, aerobic capacity, flexibility, and body composition by using a scientifically based health-related fitness assessment.

F741C7F0DFE301318EA568A86D17958E.description: Students assess and maintain a level of physical fitness to improve health and performance.

F7416C90DFE301318EA468A86D17958E.description: Develop an individual or dual game that uses a manipulative skill, two different offensive strategies, and a scoring system and teach it to another person.

F74100C0DFE301318EA368A86D17958E.description: Combination of Movement Patterns and Skills

F740BB30DFE301318EA268A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe key elements in the mature performance of overhand, sidearm, and underhand throwing; catching; kicking/punting; striking; trapping; dribbling (hand and foot); and volleying.

F7403880DFE301318EA068A86D17958E.description: Diagram and demonstrate basic offensive and defensive strategies for individual and dual physical activities.

F73FFAE0DFE301318E9F68A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast the effectiveness of practicing skills as a whole and practicing skills in smaller parts.

F73FBAD0DFE301318E9E68A86D17958E.description: Explain and demonstrate spin and rebound principles for performing manipulative skills.

F73F76D0DFE301318E9D68A86D17958E.description: Use principles of motor learning to establish, monitor, and meet goals for motor skill development.

F73F3010DFE301318E9C68A86D17958E.description: Analyze movement patterns and correct errors.

F73EB430DFE301318E9A68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate knowledge of movement concepts, principles, and strategies that apply to the learning and performance of physical activities.

F73E6FF0DFE301318E9968A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate body management and object-manipulation skills needed for successful participation in introductory adventure/outdoor activities.

F73E2420DFE301318E9868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate body management and locomotor skills needed for successful participation in track and field and combative activities.

F73DD620DFE301318E9768A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate body management and object-manipulation skills needed for successful participation in individual and dual physical activities.

F73D77B0DFE301318E9668A86D17958E.description: Combine manipulative, locomotor, and nonlocomotor skills into movement patterns.

F73D38D0DFE301318E9568A86D17958E.description: Combinations of Movement Patterns and Skills

F73C6FD0DFE301318E9268A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate mature techniques for the following patterns: overhand, sidearm, and underhand throwing; catching; kicking/punting; striking; trapping; dribbling (hand and foot); and volleying.

F73BD980DFE301318E9068A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate the motor skills and movement patterns needed to perform a variety of physical activities.
